titleStmt.title: A cruell murther committed lately upon the body of Abraham Gearsy who liv'd in the Parish of Westmill, in the County of Harford; by one Robert Reeve, and Richard Reeve, both of the same Parish: for which fact Robert was prest to death, on Munday the 16. of March, and the Tuesday following Richard was hang'd; and after both of them were hang'd up in chaines, where now they doe remaine, to the affrightment of all beholders. 1635. To the tune of Fortune my Foe.
titleStmt.author: Crimsal, Richard.

publicationStmt.publisher: for Iohn Wyright Iunior, dwelling at the upper end of the Old Baily,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "I pray give eare unto my tale of woe,".
Signed at end: R.C., i.e. Richard Crimsal.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the upper end of the Old Baily
